Function# vtruncf(_:)

iOS 6.0+iPadOS 6.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.9+tvOSvisionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
func vtruncf(_: vFloat) -> vFloat
```

## [See Also](/documentation/Accelerate/vtruncf(_:)#see-also)

### [Floating-Point Arithmetic and Auxiliary Functions (from vfp.h)](/documentation/Accelerate/vtruncf(_:)#Floating-Point-Arithmetic-and-Auxiliary-Functions-from-vfph)

[`func vceilf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vceilf(_:))Computes the ceiling of values in a vector of floating-point values.[`func vcopysignf(vFloat, vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vcopysignf(_:_:))For each vector element, produces a value with the magnitude of `arg2` and sign `arg1`. Note that the order of the arguments matches the recommendation of the IEEE 754 floating-point standard, which is opposite from the SANE copysign function.[`func vdivf(vFloat, vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vdivf(_:_:))For each vector element, calculates `A`/`B`.[`func vfabf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vfabf(_:))For each vector element, calculates the absolute value of `v`.Deprecated[`func vfabsf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vfabsf(_:))[`func vfloorf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vfloorf(_:))Computes the floor of values in a vector of floating-point values.[`func vintf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vintf(_:))Truncates the decimal portion of a vector of floating-point values.Deprecated[`func vnintf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vnintf(_:))Rounds to the nearest integer (nearest even for ties).[`func vnextafterf(vFloat, vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vnextafterf(_:_:))For each vector element, calculates the next representable value after `x` in the direction of `y`. If `x` is equal to `y`, then `y` is returned.[`func vrecf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vrecf(_:))Computes the reciprocal of values in a vector.[`func vrsqrtf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vrsqrtf(_:))For each vector element, calculates the inverse of the square root of `X`.[`func vsqrtf(vFloat) -> vFloat`](/documentation/accelerate/vsqrtf(_:))For each vector element, calculates the square root of `X`.[`func vtablelookup(vSInt32, UnsafeMutablePointer<UInt32>) -> vUInt32`](/documentation/accelerate/vtablelookup(_:_:))For each vector element of `Index_Vect`, returns the corresponding value from `Table`.
